title: Pretty sure I just got destroyed by community
body:
Not gonna name names or anything like that would like to preface by saying not the best player in the world. So I just played a game 2w 2l into my promos for G5 we in the 5th game. I'm playing support and we are winning just slightly it is a solid game. Our adc is not a pleasant person he all caps yells at everyone for the slightest things and sometimes for things the other 4 people can't fathom.

So in this close, fun and all round great game he decides screw it leona this is your game 5 for gold right? Me "yeah man lets do this" He then afk's purely to spite me my adc as a support who has warded, not ks'd when possible built correctly done everything I as a lowly oceanic scrub just climbing his way up the ranks can be decides no you don't deserve gold im afk. Team completely gives up even with me trying to band everyone together they all concede since to them its over.

Im not mad im not angry im just really offended pretty sure this is the first thing ive ever actuality typed on the forums now that I think about it. Im gonna take a break for a while and just see how it goes just felt the need to vent because as a human that's probably the mostly petty yet insulting thing ive ever experienced.

Sorry in advance for any grammar mistakes and the for the overall uselessness of this post just needed to type things out.
Sincerely T.Ramen

The biggest reason we don't do this is because of match making. Leaving/dcing from a game doesn't make you a worse player. If we heavily reduced MMR every time someone left a game (whether intentionally or unintentionally) we would be really messing up the match making system. This would result in matching making becoming more and more inaccurate, which would impact not only the game that a leave happens but all subsequent games where this really good player is matched with a bunch of players that aren't in his league. No one likes being stomped in lane and game.

Another key point to keep in mind is, if you leave a game you already lose MMR and LP (because you most likely lose the 4v5). So leavers already don't care about that enough to stop them from leaving.

The problem we are trying to fix is Leavers, I believe the low priority queue is actually a great deterrent (even better than bans). Let me explain what it does and why I think its so good. This is what happens to a player that gets punished by low priority queue;

Before each game they queue up for they must wait 10 mins to 1 hour before they actually begin queuing for a game. They get this punishment for 5 games. This means before each game for 5 games you must wait 10 mins - 1 hour before you even join a queue for the game mode you want. If you don't improve (i.e. if you dont start leaving less) then the punishments increase in time and games.

e.g. 5 games 10 minute low priority queue ----> 5 games 20 minute priority queue -----> 5 games 30 minute priority queue ---> 10 games 20 minute low priority queue ----> etc etc (potentially wasting hours just waiting to play)

Now why do I like this so much more than bans? If you account gets banned then you just go play on a smurf or other account until the ban is over. But the low priority queue is not a certain time you need to wait (days or weeks) so you cant just wait it out on another account. It is designed so the person that is being punished has to play through the punishment (wait through looooooong queues) if they want to play on their main AND if they don't improve they will keep getting hit with harsher punishments.

Happy to hear your thoughts.

Hey Perdues, 

I understand your thoughts on this topic, it is definitely frustrating when people leave/dc/afk (lets just classify this as Leaves from now on) especially during a promo series. I feel I wasn't clear enough when I said "consistent". What I meant is in terms of leaves players have a little leeway because of random disconnects outside of their control (power cuts, storms etc). But any player that leaves more than the leeway for random disconnects will get hit with Leaver Buster.

The main reason for this is it is very difficult to distinguish from a DC/plug pull.

If you KS'd the kills you could have carried, bad support IMO.
When I play support I play champs like Nidalee and LeBlanc, and just use my trinket and steal all the kills, ADC never rages just don't touch CS.

That is the worst Support philosophy I have ever heard, troll or no.

The role of the support is to make sure the glass cannon on the team deals it's damage without getting shattered. This is also why I think the best supports are those that offer good, solid CC, like Morganna and Blitzcrank. That way the have good peel, as well as good lockdown so that they can keep the damage dealers alive and get them fed. Don't take CS, and don't steal the kill unless they are going to get away (this is the only situation that I think a KS is okay)

**In regards to supports taking kills**

I main support so I thought I'd throw my two cents into the mix;

I enjoy playing a fairly aggressive support, so I typically play champions like Lulu, Sona, Karma and Nami. I usually run with Flash/Ignite so if my ADC is low and can't chase and if the enemy champ is low enough, I can combo and secure a kill for the team.

In my opinion, it's perfectly fine for a support to take kills if their ADC/other team mates aren't able to. I would never intentionally take my teammates kills as a support.

That being said, if my team is struggling, I often switch to "AP-Support" meaning I still get the essential support items:

{{item:3092}} + {{item:2045}} + {{item:3341}}

However I then proceed to build AP. This is when I would start to aim for kills (where appropriate). At the end of the day it's still far more beneficial to help your teammates get the kills, but it can also be helpful to your team if you have the ability to land some yourself. I've been successful in turning some pretty grizzly looking matches into wins - not only is it fun, it's pretty satisfying!

I'm a huge believer in that the game isn't over until it's over. I've noticed  in quite a few of the in 4v5 matches I've encountered that the team with 5 players seem to start playing less seriously and become overly confident in their win - when this happens - you definitely have the opportunity to turn the match around.

-Tak

Maraudaur,

Now that you've explained what a low priority que is I do think that they would be better for player reform than bans. I had previously received a message from leaverbuster about being put into a low priority que, but did not notice any difference in que times or the calibre of those I was in que with.

I actually thought the system was broken, a "bank error in your favour" if you will, but I think there may be a glitch in the system. I rarely solo-q, I normally duo q ranked. Is it possible that when duo-q with someone who doesn't have a low priority que you are placed in the regular que?

Point 1. How does low Priority que effect que-ing with friends?

Point 2. I don't have a low priority restriction but a friend does, when I invite them to game why do I not get a warning about having to join a low priority que if queing with them? - Kind of like the delay box you get when someone has dodged?

I hope this will inspire you:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FMUzVccdilw

Sometimes typing things out can help vent the frustration - so hopefully this made you feel even a tiny bit better!

All the best in getting Gold - you've got this! =D

-Tak
